title: Michelle Steel
added: Steel opposes same-sex marriage. In 2014, after her daughter voiced support for same-sex marriage, Steel withdrew her from the [[University of California Santa Cruz]] and sent her to [[Loyola Marymount]], a private Jesuit university, for a "brainwash".<ref>{{cite web |title=Republican congressional candidate bragged about pulling daughter out of university for ‘brainwashing’ after she supported equal marriage |url=https://www.pinknews.co.uk/2020/07/07/michelle-steel-california-orange-county-republican-daughter-university-santa-cruz-equal-marriage/ |website=PinkNews - Gay news, reviews and comment from the world's most read lesbian, gay, bisexual, and trans news service |accessdate=21 August 2020 |date=7 July 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Bollinger |first1=Alex |title=Republican candidate brags about pulling her daughter out of college for supporting LGBTQ rights |url=https://www.lgbtqnation.com/2020/07/republican-candidate-brags-pulling-daughter-college-supporting-lgbtq-rights/ |website=LGBTQ Nation |accessdate=21 August 2020 |date=8 July 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=California GOP congressional candidate claimed she withdrew her daughter from college for supporting gay marriage |url=https://www.metroweekly.com/2020/07/california-gop-congressional-candidate-claimed-she-withdrew-her-daughter-from-college-for-supporting-gay-marriage/ |website=Metro Weekly |accessdate=21 August 2020 |date=8 July 2020}}</ref>

title: Michelle Steel
added: Part of the Board that wanted to rush schools into reopening even though teachers and parents were against the idea.

added: Steel opposes same-sex marriage. title: Michelle Steel
deleted: During the [[COVID-19 pandemic]], she opposed mandatory facemasks in Orange County.<ref>{{cite news |last1=options |first1= |last2= |first2= |title=Californians must wear face masks in public under coronavirus order issued by Newsom |url=https://www.latimes.com/california/story/2020-06-18/california-mandatory-face-masks-statewide-order-coronavirus-gavin-newsom |accessdate=23 July 2020 |work=Los Angeles Times |date=18 June 2020}}</ref> She voted against requiring face coverings for retail employees,<ref>{{cite web |last1= |first1= |title=OC Supervisors Vote To Require Face Coverings For Many Retail Employees |url=https://mynewsla.com/business/2020/04/21/oc-supervisors-vote-to-require-face-coverings-for-many-retail-employees/ |website=MyNewsLA.com |accessdate=23 July 2020 |date=22 April 2020}}</ref> and opposed requirements of masks in public schools.<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|last2=|last3=|first3=|last4=|last5=|last6=|last7=|first7=|last8=|date=2020-10-21|title=Mailbag: Controversies, contributions drive concerns about Orange County races|url=https://www.latimes.com/socal/daily-pilot/opinion/story/2020-10-20/mailbag-controversies-contributions-drive-concerns-about-orange-county-races|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-10-21|website=LA Times|language=en-US}}</ref> She questioned the medical effectiveness of masks in preventing the virus spread.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Custodio|first=Spencer|date=2020-05-26|title=Orange County Public Health Officials Under Fire Over Mask Order|url=https://voiceofoc.org/2020/05/orange-county-public-health-officials-under-fire-from-over-mask-order/|access-date=2020-10-21|website=Voice of OC|language=en-US}}</ref>
